title: torch.autograd.backward does not handle dependent Variables correctly
body_html:
Here's a failure case on master:

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

x = Variable(torch.randn(10), requires_grad=True)
y = x ** 2
z = y ** 3

torch.autograd.backward([y, z], [torch.randn(10), torch.randn(10)])

and here's the stack-trace:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "foo.py", line 10, in <module>
    torch.autograd.backward([y, z], [torch.randn(10), torch.randn(10)])
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/__init__.py", line 98, in backward
    variables, grad_variables, retain_graph)
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/function.py", line 90, in apply
    return self._forward_cls.backward(self, *args)
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/_functions/basic_ops.py", line 209, in backward
    var, = ctx.saved_variables
RuntimeError: Trying to backward through the graph second time, but the buffers have already been freed. Please specify retain_variables=True when calling backward for the first time.
body_text:
Here's a failure case on master:
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

x = Variable(torch.randn(10), requires_grad=True)
y = x ** 2
z = y ** 3

torch.autograd.backward([y, z], [torch.randn(10), torch.randn(10)])
and here's the stack-trace:
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/__init__.py", line 98, in backward
    variables, grad_variables, retain_graph)
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/function.py", line 90, in apply
    return self._forward_cls.backward(self, *args)
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/_functions/basic_ops.py", line 209, in backward
    var, = ctx.saved_variables
RuntimeError: Trying to backward through the graph second time, but the buffers have already been freed. Please specify retain_variables=True when calling backward for the first time.
body:
Here's a failure case on master:

```python
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

x = Variable(torch.randn(10), requires_grad=True)
y = x ** 2
z = y ** 3

torch.autograd.backward([y, z], [torch.randn(10), torch.randn(10)])
```

and here's the stack-trace:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "foo.py", line 10, in <module>
    torch.autograd.backward([y, z], [torch.randn(10), torch.randn(10)])
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/__init__.py", line 98, in backward
    variables, grad_variables, retain_graph)
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/function.py", line 90, in apply
    return self._forward_cls.backward(self, *args)
  File "/home/soumith/code/pytorch/torch/autograd/_functions/basic_ops.py", line 209, in backward
    var, = ctx.saved_variables
RuntimeError: Trying to backward through the graph second time, but the buffers have already been freed. Please specify retain_variables=True when calling backward for the first time.
```
